instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message:
Clean board, no history.

All SSD rails measure correct.

Tried restoring and reviving T2 but fails.

Starting from external drive not possible because we cannot change startup options in recovery mode.

I am assuming that NAND chips or one of them may be dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message: Any liquid sign at audio board and flex?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message: Thanks, audio board and flex are perfect clean, connectors are also fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message: Machine stays on in boot menu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message:
This happened to me with 01521 board.
I finally found a shorted signal from a speaker amp to T2; it was located inside T2.
Was impossible to complete DFU on it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message: Yes in this case T2 is unable to restore/revive, I will check again the audio board and see, thanks a lot!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message:
I had one with T2 shorted on <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>; caused by leakage from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> in audio board.
That one I got it working after complete DFU,
Of course, no speaker sound, only headphones.

The one above mentioned (previous post), never complete DFU and was impossible to repair it.
T2 found shorted on a line corresponding to the other (onboard) speaker amp.
However, on other service, both boards have been connected in the same shell, with liquid damaged audio board and flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message: This board and audio board is clean and there is no sings of water damage, I tried a new audio board but no luck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
threads.message:
I just gave an example about very similar symptom, caused by T2 internal damage.
In your case, can be other reason of damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots shortly after boot up bar starts to load.
